intro: Caralluma sprengeri subsp. foetida, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, often inconspicuous flowers. It produces berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Due to its ability to store water, it is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
